Home / Tools / DevEx Funnel Calculator

Lifecycle Economics

DevEx Funnel Cost Calculator

Translate developer lifecycle friction into financial impact from role planning through post-employment transitions, with DORA and DX Core 4 guidance overlays.

How To Use This Form

Use the form top-down. Start with team economics, then lifecycle timing, then overlays. The calculator estimates delay cost, not individual performance.
  1. Set `Team and Cost Basis` to model your current org baseline.
  2. Set `Lens Weights` to reflect how your leadership values labor, revenue, opportunity, and goodwill.
  3. Set `Global Lens Day Rates` for non-labor financial impact; leave zero if unknown.
  4. Populate `Lifecycle Stages` with target vs actual days. Delay is `max(actual - target, 0)`.
  5. Adjust `Interview Team Effort` so hiring-stage labor reflects real interviewer time.
  6. Fill `DORA Translation Inputs` for executive language. Keep DORA as contextual signal unless you intentionally include it in totals.
  7. Run `Calculate`, then inspect the top friction stage, Core 4 distribution, and one-day sensitivity savings.

Interpretation: stages show where delay occurs, DX Core 4 indicates likely systemic friction categories, and DORA helps communicate delivery implications in familiar terms.

Framework Context

DX Core 4 is used here as the primary interpretation lens. DORA is included as a translation layer for delivery conversations, and Golden Signals language is adapted to software lifecycle phases.

  • DX Core 4 overview: framing that combines DORA, SPACE, and DevEx into one productivity model.
  • DX Core 4 benchmarks: comparison context for expected ranges and performance bands.
  • DORA software delivery metrics: deployment and reliability language used for executive translation.
  • Golden Signals reference (Google SRE): latency, errors, traffic, and saturation as a reliability framing base.

What Core 4 means in this calculator: lifecycle stages are your value stream, while DX Core 4 cards group those stages into systemic friction domains so you can prioritize interventions.

What this calculator can inform: where compounding delay cost is accumulating, which phase offers highest one-day savings, how interview/onboarding friction contributes to downstream flow, and how to communicate delivery impacts in DORA terms without making DORA the primary model.

Inputs

Team and Cost Basis ?
Lens Weights (Percent) ?
Global Lens Day Rates ($/day) ?
Labor day rate defaults to blended fully-loaded team daily rate.
Lifecycle Stages (Planning -> Post-employment) ?

Stage overrides are optional. Leave blank to use global defaults and blended labor rate. ?

Stage Target days Actual days Labor $/day override Revenue $/day override Opportunity $/day override Goodwill $/day override Actions
Interview Team Effort (Stage: Job Req -> Hiring Process) ?
DORA Translation Inputs ?

This maps DORA language into delay-cost terms for executive reporting. DORA remains informational unless explicitly included in totals.

DORA cost impact is computed as extra lead-time delay + excess-failure recovery delay.

Results

`Composite Cost (Lifecycle)` is always lifecycle-only. `Composite Cost (With Toggle Mode)` includes DORA only when the checkbox is enabled.
